results.headline: Review: In ‘Lila and Eve,’ a Grieving Mother Turns Gun-Toting Vigilante
results.summary_short: Viola Davis and Jennifer Lopez star in this revenge thriller, directed by Charles Stone III (“Drumline”).

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lila and Eve

results.headline: Review: For Ian McKellen’s ‘Mr. Holmes,’ Retirement Is Afoot
results.summary_short: “Mr. Holmes” imagines the later years of Arthur Conan Doyle’s beloved detective, who hasn’t quite given up making brilliant deductions.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mr. Holmes

results.headline: Review: ‘Famous Nathan’ Tells How Nathan Handwerker Built a Hot Dog Empire
results.summary_short: Mr. Handwerker’s grandson Lloyd uses interviews and archival footage to chronicle the driving force behind Nathan’s Famous.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Famous Nathan

results.headline: Review: ‘Ardor’ Depicts an Argentine Land Grab and a Quest for Vengeance
results.summary_short: In Pablo Fendrick’s film, a mysterious man pursues mercenaries through the jungle after they murder a farmer and abduct his daughter.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ardor

results.headline: Review: ‘Ant-Man,’ With Paul Rudd, Adds to a Superhero Infestation
results.summary_short: Directed by Peyton Reed, this movie is a passable piece of drone work from the ever-expanding Marvel-Disney colony.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ant-Man

results.headline: Review: ‘Court’ Is Chaitanya Tamhane’s Unsparing Look at Justice in India
results.summary_short: This film about a fictional singer-activist accused of encouraging a suicide looks pointedly at class, corruption and other social issues.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Court

results.headline: Review: ‘Jellyfish Eyes,’ a Children’s Film From Takashi Murakami
results.summary_short: The movie, which blends real actors and animated creatures, focuses on a boy who moves to a new town and is befriended by a jellyfish-like sprite.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jellyfish Eyes

results.headline: Review: ‘Tangerine,’ a Madcap Buddy Picture About Transgender Prostitutes
results.summary_short: Sean Baker’s fast, funny comedy, shot on iPhones, doesn’t dive deep into transgender identity but shows that femininity is a mask that can be slipped on and off.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tangerine

results.display_title: What We Did On Our Holiday
results.headline: Review: ‘What We Did on Our Holiday’ Transfers Sitcom Formula to the Big Screen
results.summary_short: David Tennant and Rosamund Pike star as squabbling parents in this family movie directed by the team from the BBC sitcom “Outnumbered.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of What We Did On Our Holiday

results.headline: Review: ‘The Gallows’ Somehow Finds More Horror Footage
results.summary_short: This movie about high school students trapped in a seemingly haunted auditorium has plenty of rickety camerawork, but that doesn’t add to the scariness.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Gallows

results.headline: Review: ‘Tap World’ Documentary Features a Variety of Quick-Stepping Dancers
results.summary_short: Dean Hargrove’s film focuses on an assortment of tap dancers proclaiming their love for the art, although it is light on the nuts and bolts of the discipline.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tap World

results.headline: Review: ‘Stations of the Cross,’ a Portrait of Religious Fervor
results.summary_short: This movie by the German director Dietrich Brüggemann can be viewed three ways: as a critique, a spiritual work or a sly comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kreuzweg

results.headline: Review: ‘SlingShot’ Documentary Pitches Solution to Global Water Crisis
results.summary_short: The inventor of the water purifier, Dean Kamen, thinks his device can bring fresh water to the world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Slingshot

results.headline: Review: Robin Williams as a Hustler-Hiring Husband in ‘Boulevard’
results.summary_short: Mr. Williams plays a 60-year-old bank officer in a passionless marriage whose life is shaken up by the company of a male hustler.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Boulevard

results.headline: Review: Positions Wanted by Minions Experienced at Serving Evildoers
results.summary_short: Those look-alike yellow guys become miserable when they have no one to help, albeit incompetently, in the first movie that’s all about them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Minions

results.headline: Review: ‘Meet Me in Montenegro,’ Romance for Ex-Lovers
results.summary_short: The directors Linnea Saasen and Alex Holdridge both wrote and starred in this film, which is a semi-autobiographical love story of their own lives.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Meet Me in Montenegro

results.headline: Review: In ‘Strangerland,’ Relocating Does Little to Ease a Family’s Strains
results.summary_short: This fiction feature debut from Kim Farrant centers on a family of new arrivals in an Australian desert town, which is soon clouded by mystery and a dust storm.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Strangerland

results.headline: Review: In ‘Self/less,’ Immortality at a Cost
results.summary_short: Ben Kingsley plays a terminally ill real estate magnate who pays a lot of money to have his consciousness uploaded into Ryan Reynolds’s body.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Self/Less

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mad Women,’ a Small-Town Political Family With Issues
results.summary_short: Characters in Jeff Lipsky’s dramedy include a mother running for mayor, a father facing a rape charge and a daughter trying to help her mother manage.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mad Women

results.headline: Review: In ‘10.000 km,’ Lovers an Ocean Apart Struggle to Connect
results.summary_short: Carlos Marques-Marcet’s film about a couple’s shift to a long-distance relationship looks at the role technology plays in negotiating absence.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 10,000 KM
